modules.description: This interface provides functions to create, compare, and convert four-byte OpenType tags, which identify font tables in OpenType fonts. It supports operations between string, integer, and binary representations of these tags, enabling access to critical font data such as glyph outlines (`glyf`), character mappings (`cmap`), kerning pairs (`kern`), and digital signatures (`dsig`) during font decoding or processing. These operations are essential for low-level manipulation and analysis of font structures.

This module offers low-level operations to parse and validate OpenType fonts in memory, manipulate four-byte tags and Unicode code points, and decode structured data like glyph IDs, font metrics, and kerning pairs from tables such as `cmap`, `glyf`, and `hhea`. It operates on in-memory font data using decoders and result types to handle parsing errors, supporting use cases like text rendering engines or font analysis tools that require direct access to OpenType table structures. Key data structures include encoded tags, Unicode ranges, and validated font metadata extracted from raw OpenType streams.
